greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = 82n^3 - 1228n^2 + 6130n - 5861.
comment: For n=0 ... 31, the absolute value of terms in this sequence are primes.  This is not the case for n=32. See A272323 and A272324. - _Robert Price_, Apr 25 2016
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Prime-Generating Polynomials
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (4,-6,4,-1).
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[(13301 x^3 - 29515 x^2 + 22567 x - 5861)/(x - 1)^4, {x, 0, 31}], x] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Apr 25 2016 *)
results.author: Hilko Koning (hilko(AT)hilko.net), Nov 18 2002
